Description: Thirty-seven people were killed in three days in the Brazilian city of Manaus, and one hypothesis being considered is a coordinated wave of attacks involving police, an official said.
At least six people were killed on Friday in clashes between pro-Islamist protesters and Egyptian police in Cairo, the health ministry said.
Secondary.Source.Type: MENA news agency, Cairo, Aswat Masriya

Description: Thirty-eight people, mostly displaced persons, have been reportedly killed and scores wounded, including women and children, when unidentified warplanes shelled Al-Rutbah district, south-west of al-Ramadi.

"Federal police executed at least 22 civilians on a ranch on the ranch in Tanhuato, Michoacan on May 22, 2015, then moved bodies and planted guns to corroborate the official account that the deaths happened in a gunbattle, Mexico's human rights commission said Thursday."

India and Pakistan traded blame on Thursday for a series of firefights and shelling over the past two days along their border in the disputed Kashmir region near the eastern city of Sialkot that killed four Pakistani civilians and one Indian and wounded nine people.

Perp.State.Police: Border Guards and the Central Reserve Police
Description: Seven people were killed and several others wounded in an attack by Ziyadiya paramilitaries of the Border Guards and the Central Reserve Police (locally known as Abu Tira) on six Berti villages in Mellit locality, North Darfur, on Sunday. They also stole hundreds of cattle.

At least nine people were killed and nine others were wounded on Tuesday in attacks by militiamen and elements of the paramilitary Border Guards on the market of Kafod and surrounding villages in El Fasher locality.
Kenyan defence forces' air-strikes have killed at least 17 people including women and children and wounded 8 others in villages in the vicinity of Dhamas near Somalia-Kenya border, residents said.

The African Union Mission in Somalia (Amisom) troops on Tuesday [21 July] fired several mortar rounds into residential areas in Merca town [south Somalia], 109 km south-west of Mogadishu, residents said. The attack killed at least 19 people while more than 17 others injured in the shelling, residents told Shabeelle Media based in Mogadishu. The incident came after anonymous gunmen hurled hand grenades on African Union peacekeepers from Burundi.
Secondary.Source.Type: Radio Dalsan website, Mogadishu, Shabelle Media Network website, Mogadishu, Radio Al-Furqaan website in Somali 1800 gmt 21 Jul 15

Description: At least 10 people were killed on Friday [3 July] by a Saudi bombing attack on a residential building in Bait al-Faqih district of Hudaydah province, a security source said.
Secondary.Source.Type: Yemen News Agency Saba website, Sanaa
Comments: Geonames gives two populated places by this name in Hudayah, this one is the administrative center

Description: A massive airstrike by the Saudi-led coalition targeting rebels in Yemen hit a local marketplace in Fayoush on Monday, killing more than 45 civilians and wounding at least 50, security officials and eyewitnesses said.

The Houthi-run Saba news agency said 40 people who had been shopping at a market had been killed in an air raid by Saudi forces in an area called Lower Joub in the Eyal Yazeed district in the Amran province, north of the capital Sanaa.
Comments: Could not find coordinates for either place name so just put it north west of Sanaa towards Amran

Description: Saudi-led air raids killed 21 civilians and wounded 45 others in Yemen's capital Sanaa on Monday morning, relatives of the victims and medics told Reuters
Around 11 people were killed and others injured due to Saudi raids on al-Dhakra junction, Maweyah district of Taiz province, a local source said Wednesday.
Secondary.Source.Type: Yemen News Agency Saba website, Sanaa
Comments: Coordinate are for Mawiyah district

Description: Saudi-led coalition airstrikes killed at least 60 civilians and wounded 98 after shelling a residential area in the town of Mokha in the Yemeni province of Taiz on Friday evening, security officials, medical officials and witnesses said.
Comments: Other reports say 35 and 120 dead

Description: The African Union Mission for Somalia (AMISOM) forces have been accused of killing at least 7 people after roadside bomb hit its armoured convoy in Marka town in Lower Shabelle, residents said. AMISOM later apologized for the incident.
Secondary.Source.Type: Shabelle Media Network website, Mogadishu, Shabelle Media Network, Dalsan Radio

Description: Nineteen people were killed and seven injured overnight in a wave of shootings in Brazil's biggest city Sao Paulo, a security official said Friday after reports of a massacre in the suburbs. Police are suspected as the perpetrators, with their motive revenge for the killings of a policeman and a security officer.

Locality: Balakote, Manjakote, Sabzian, Mandi, Mankot, Hamirpur
Description: Nisar Ahmad Wani, an administrator near the Line of Control, a ceasefire line dividing Kashmir between India and Pakistan, in Indian-controlled Poonch district, said six civilians, including a 12-year-old child, were killed by Pakistan firing and twenty people were injured on Saturday.
Comments: Three Pakistani civilians also killed by Indian artillery.

Description: At least six civilians were killed near the city of Sialkot in Pakistan's Punjab province and 46 wounded Friday as India and Pakistan traded fire across their disputed border, officials said.
Somalia's Interim Jubba administration soldiers have shot and killed at least 5 unarmed civilians and wounded 5 others outside Kismayo town in Lower Juba region.
Comments: Jubba administration says killings accidental; Somali military says deliberate. Location is ``30 km from Kismayo'' but no further detail so coordinates are just Kismayo

Description: Six members of the same family were killed and others injured in a Saudi raid on citizens' houses in the Al-Askari area in the Sabir al-Mawadim district in Taiz province, a local source said Tuesday

A Saudi-led coalition air strike killed 13 teaching staff and four children in northern Yemen, in a raid apparently targeting Shiite rebels, medics and witnesses said Thursday. UNICEF condemned what it called Tuesday's \"senseless bloodshed\" in Amran province that it said killed 17 civilians and also injured 20 other people.
Comments: No location given except Amran province

Description: Doctors Without Borders said Friday that Saudi-led airstrikes on a residential district in Yemens southwestern city of Taiz had killed more than 65 civilians, including 17 people from one family. At least fifty people were wounded.
The fighting and air raids in Mukayris, a town seen as a gateway to southern provinces recently recaptured by pro-government forces, left six civilians dead

An air strike by warplanes from a Saudi-led coalition, which said it targeted a bomb-making factory, killed 36 civilians working at a bottling plant in the northern Yemeni province of Hajjah on Sunday, residents said.
Comments: Hajjah province is the only geographical information provided

Victim.Identity.Political: leader with the Freedom and Justice Party
Description: Dr Mujahid Hasan Zaki, young leader with the Freedom and Justice Party (the Muslim Brotherhood's political wing) in Bani Suwayf, was killed three days after the Interior Ministry arrested him from his apartment in Cairo.
Comments: Police claim victim committed suicide while in custody by shooting himself in the back. Seriously.

Description: Egyptian security forces killed 12 Mexican tourists and injured 10 near the Bahariya oasis after mistaking them for terrorists, the country's Interior Ministry said.

Churachandpur in the north-eastern Indian state of Manipur was on the boil on Tuesday with eight people dying and 31 injured since last night in arson, violence and clashes between mobs and police in Churachandpur district even as curfew continued since last night. The violence has been triggered by the passage of three controversial bills by the Assembly on Monday, which has caused resentment among the tribals who fear that their land rights would be snatched by \"outsiders\".

Nepali police shot dead at least four protesters and killed a fifth on Tuesday as demonstrators threw stones and petrol bombs in the neighboring towns of Birgunj and Kalaiya in southern Nepal, angry at a new planned constitution.
Comments: Coordinates for Birgunj, where 4 deaths occurred. Opposition leaders say at least some of those killed were not protesting violently.

Description: Six persons were killed in Dhanusha's Janakpur and Mahottari's Jaleshwor when police opened fire at the agitators for defying curfew today.
Comments: Coordinates are for Janakpur

Description: Thousands of relatives and mourners marched through the centre of the mainly-Kurdish southeastern city of Cizre on Sept. 13 to bury 16 people who lost their lives in clashes during a nine-day Turkish army imposed curfew. The Kurdish-problem-focused Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP) said 21 civilians were killed during the anti-PKK operation, which deprived residents of access to essential amenities and triggered food shortages. According to the DIHA news agency, the dead included a 35-day-old baby, several teenagers and three men aged 70 or over.
Comments: Details sketchy on circumstances of deaths; Turkish Army claims 32 PKK `militants' killed during this period

Description: At least 10 people have been killed and 113 injured in clashes since this week's military coup in Burkina Faso, a hospital source said Saturday.
Comments: Trade unions say 20 killed; 10 is figure from hospital

Description: Jets belonging to a Saudi-led coalition accidentally killed at least 20 people at a wake in the region of al-Yutma in al-Jawf province north of Sanaa on Sunday, local tribesmen said
Comments: Could not geolocate al-Yutma; coordinates are for al-Jawf

Description: At least seven civilians were killed in Sanaa, where coalition warplanes targeted the police academy and the headquarters of the security services, both in the heart of the rebel-controlled capital, witnesses said.
Six Indian nationals were killed when their boats came under attack during Saudi-led coalition air strikes on fuel smugglers at Yemen's Hodeidah port on Tuesday, residents and fishermen said.
Comments: Unclear whether victims were working for the smugglers

Description: Saudi-led coalition warplanes have mistakenly killed eight Yemeni civilians, including several beekeepers, during air strikes in Bayhan, on the border between Shabwa and Marib provinces, aimed at Iran-backed rebels, a local official said Thursday.
Ten people from a single family in Taiz were killed in air strikes by a Saudi-led military coalition on Saturday, medics said.

At least nine Yemeni civilians were killed in air strikes by Saudi-led warplanes that targeted the home of a leader in the dominant Houthi movement in the capital Sanaa, medical sources said on Thursday. The leader was not in the house at the time.
Airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition targeting Shiite rebels have killed at least 15 people  all members of one family  in Yemen's capital, Sanaa, security and medical officials said Monday.
Warplanes of a Saudi-led alliance struck a hotel in the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Tuesday killing at least 20 people, most of them civilians, medical officials and local officials said.
A Saudi air strike has killed six citizens of one family and injured twenty others in targeting a house in Aflah al-Yemen district in Hajjah Governorate [in northwestern Yemen].

A local official and residents said at least 40 people, mostly women or children, were killed on Monday in either an air strike or missile attack on a wedding party in the village of al-Wahijah, near the Red Sea port city of Al-Mokha. in southwest Yemen, but a Saudi-led coalition that has air supremacy over the country strongly denied any role.
Comments: Could not geolocate al-Wahijah; coordinates are for Al-Mokha. Saudis usually don't deny these attacks, so they may not be responsible for this one. Houthi sources later put death total at over 130.

Description: Airstrikes by a Saudi-led military coalition have killed at least 13 civilians and wounded 11 others working at a water plant in Hajja Province in northern Yemen, the plants owner said.
Comments: No location given except Hajja province

Description: A rocket has landed in a residential house in Nade-e Ali District of [the southern] Helmand Province. Five people, including women and children, have been killed as a result. The house's owner claimed that the rocket was fired by the National Army.
Secondary.Source.Type: Afghan Islamic Press news agency, Peshawar

Description: Police from the API (support for the protection of institutions) in civilian clothes massacred 10 civilians on Buye Avenue in Ngagara zone section 3.

The governor of North-Kivu province in troubled eastern DRCongo told AFP on Thursday that five civilians had been killed in a UN helicopter attack against rebel fighters in the village of Musanga this week.
Comments: UN response was ambivalent, saying they had attacked rebels in the area but could not confirm the civilian deaths. Suggesting the deaths did occur.

Locality: near Nahal Oz (Israel) and Khan Younis
Description: Israeli soldiers killed six young Palestinians on Friday in the Gaza Strip, including a 15-year-old boy, as they opened fire to quell crowds that hurled rocks and rolled burning tires close to the fence separating Gaza from Israel near the Israeli kibbutz of Nahal Oz, Israeli military and Gaza health officials said. At least 80 people were injured.
Comments: 4 killed near Nahal Oz; 2 near Khan Younis; coordinates at border near Nahal Oz

Perp.State.Military: African Union mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces
Description: The African Union mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces have shot and killed a traditional elder and wounded two others in Gandershe village near Marko city on Wednesday, witness said.
Secondary.Source.Type: Dhacdo.com website, Hargeysa, Shabelle Media Network

Description: At least a dozen civilians have been killed over the weekend in the Burundi capital Bujumbura, sources told AFP Sunday.
Comments: Headline says deaths are in the context of violent police/protester clashes, but the eyewitness reports simply indicate bodies found in the street

Description: A Burundian journalist, his wife and their two children were shot dead by security forces in the capital Bujumbura amid tensions following the re-election of President Pierre Nkurunziza, residents said Wednesday.

Victim.Identity.Political: staffer of International Organization for Migration
Description: A spokesman for the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights reported that a staffer of the Geneva-based International Organization for Migration was \"reportedly summarily executed\" by special police unit forces on Oct. 13 in the Ngagara neighborhood of Bujumbura, the capital.
Secondary.Source.Type: the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights

Victim.Identity.Political: deliberate targeting of pro-Houthi tribal leader?
Description: Two airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition killed at least 23 civilians and wounded 25 others in Yemen on Wednesday in Sanban, a region in Dhamar province 113 km (70 miles) southeast of the capital, Sanaa, at a wedding hosted by a tribal leader known to support the Houthi rebels, witnesses and independent security officials said.
Comments: Could not geolocate Sanban, so used the offset.

Description: 12 Somali citizens were killed after Saudi fighter jets pounded a bridge in the Bagim district of Yemen's northwestern province of Sa'ada on Saturday, Yemen's Saba Net news agency reported.
Comments: Presumably the bridge was targeted, not the Somalis. Could not geolocate Bagim district; coordinates for Sa'ada

Description: Five civilians were killed on Thursday [15 October] and four others injured in Saudi air strikes against Nuqum area in Azal district of the capital city of Sanaa.
Heavy fighting between Yemeni pro-government forces and Shiite Houthi rebels besieging the western city of Taiz has killed 11 civilians since Wednesday, Yemeni security officials said Friday.
A resident in the northern province of Hajjah said coalition planes had bombed a small island in the Red Sea close to the port of Midi, killing 10 fishermen.
Comments: Coordinates are for Midi

Description: The Sinai Branch of ISIS has claimed responsibility for the downing of the Russian airliner Metrojet 9288; 224 people were killed in the crash
Citation: AFPR000020151102ebb200aht, LBA0000020151106ebb600hx5, BBCSUP0020151101ebb1000b5, and at least 100 additional stories on the incident
Comments: Location of crash site from Wikipedia

Victim.Identity.Political: son of a leading Burundian rights activist
Description: The son of a leading Burundian rights activist was found dead Friday hours after he was arrested by police in the capital Bujumbura, his family and witnesses said.

Chinese security forces in the far western region of Xinjiang have killed 17 people, including women and children, accused of involvement in an attack at a coal mine that left at least 50 dead. U.S.-based Radio Free Asia, citing Xinjiang police, said the 17 killed were all suspects in the attack, including three men believed to have been the ringleaders and their family members.
Comments: Apparently police blew up a cave where everyone was hiding. There were no police casualties nor indications of armed resistance. Geolocation is an arbitrary point in western Xinjiang; no details were given.

Description: Nine civilians, including a child, were killed in an early morning shooting in Arish Thursday by North Sinai militants, North Sinai Governor Abdel Fattah Harhour told Egyptian state television. Harhour said that preliminary investigations revealed that all those killed belong to the same family and had been accused of collaborating with security forces.

15 Sudanese migrants were killed and another eight were injured when they attempted to climb over the border fence into Israel, Associated press reported on Sunday.The incident occurred now a wire fence separating Sinai from Israel at a border point some 17 kilometers (12 miles) south of Rafah
Secondary.Source.Type: Al Jazeera, Aswat Masriya, Radio Dabanga
Citation: APRS000020151115ebbf00439, NYTFEED020151115ebbg0030d, AFNWS00020151116ebbg000id, AFNWS00020151116ebbg001aj, AFNWS00020151116ebbg001qi, AFNWS00020151117ebbh000d1
Comments: Location approximate. Initial reports said victims were caught in a crossfire of a gun battle between Egyptian security forces and Bedouin people smugglers but AP concluded shootings were deliberate

Description: Five Sudanese nationals were killed, six injured and five arrested when Egypt's border guards thwarted an attempt to across Egypt's North Eastern border into Israel, according to an army statement published on Facebook Monday.
Comments: Location approximate; no detail given except ""border."" Egypt claims migrants shot at them first.

Description: At least 13 people, most of them civilians, were killed when rival Somali government security forces opened fire following an argument over who was in charge of issuing ration cards to internally displaced people. According to medical sources more than 19 other people were wounded in the fighting.
Secondary.Source.Type: Midnimo.com website in Somali 16 Nov 15, Goobjoog website, Mogadishu, Shabelle Media Network website, Mogadishu, Radio Mogadishu website, Mogadishu, Dhacdo.com website, Hargeysa, Somali Memo website in Somali on 16 Nov 15, Dalsan Radio, Shabelle Media Network
Citation: BBCMNF0020151116ebbg000gp, BBCMNF0020151116ebbg000jh, BBCMNF0020151116ebbg000m9, BBCAP00020151116ebbg001rx, BBCAP00020151116ebbg001up, AFPR000020151116ebbg0073l, BBCAP00020151117ebbh00004, AFNWS00020151117ebbh0009w, AFNWS00020151117ebbh000n3
Comments: Government disapproves and was seeking to arrest the perpetrators

Description: Men in police uniforms pulled five people from their houses in the Cibitoke neighborhood of Bujumbura and shot them dead on Wednesday, said a resident A human rights activist said that some of those five victims had just been released from prison where they had been held for months after being arrested on charges of protesting against Mr. Nkurunziza. Another person was shot dead Wednesday afternoon in the Jabe neighborhood, while another was killed in Bwiza by people in police uniforms on Tuesday night, witnesses said.
At least 79 people were killed, many executed in the street, by Burundi security forces in the capital Bujumbura.
Secondary.Source.Type: The Star, IRIN, Al Jazeera, Amnesty International
Comments: 4 soldiers and 4 police were reported killed, so there was apparently at least some armed resistance. 79 is the government figure for "rebels" killed; human rights groups say 154 dead and 150 disappeared in previous week.

Description: Seven people were killed in Djibouti after a religious celebration erupted into a violent clash with police, the foreign minister said on Tuesday, disputing an account by an opposition group that at least 19 people had died. At least 42 were injured.
Comments: No way to resolve government and opposition numbers on casualties; government says some protestors were armed

Description: Five Sudanese were reportedly killed and 15 others wounded in a bombardment by the Libyan Air Force in Libya's eastern town of Ajdabiya. Sources said that the bombing targeted a Sudanese cafe suspected of containing a weapon store belonging to Islamic State combatants.

A peaceful protest embarked upon by the supporters and sympathisers of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) on Tuesday turned bloody at about 1.30 a.m. on Wednesday when members of the group and Joint Military Task Force comprising the army, police, navy and the civil defence clashed at the Niger Bridge head in Onitsha. At the end of the clash, about nine members of IPOB activists were killed by the joint task force.

The killing of hundreds of Shia Muslim members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), by Nigerian army soldiers from December 12 to 14, 2015, appears to have been wholly unjustified, Human Rights Watch said today. Human Rights Watch interviewed 16 witnesses to the killings and five others, including local authorities, who said that Nigerian army soldiers fired on Shia Muslim members of the group at three locations in Zaria, in northern Nigeria. At least 300 Shia sect members, and likely many more, were killed and hundreds more injured, according to witnesses in at least two of the sites and a hospital source.
Primary.Source.Type: Reuters, All Africa, AFP, AP, BBC, NYT
Secondary.Source.Type: Premium Times, Leadership, Vanguard, Daily Trust, Nigerian Tribune website, Ibadan, This Day
Comments: Army claims much lower death total but HRW report has extensive detail, including the army burying large number of corpses in mass graves. Army claims the group was trying to assassinate the army chief of staff, Lieutenant General Tukur Buratai.

Description: At least eight people were reported killed in a clash between members of the Shi'i Islamic group and policemen in Tudun Nupawa area of Kaduna metropolis on Tuesday
Comments: IMN spokesman says group was peaceful; police do not contest this and say they were motivated by 'an intelligence report of what [the protesters] intended to do'

Victim.Identity.Political: Indigenous people of Biafra, IPOB, and Movement for the Actualization of Sovereign State of Biafra, MASSOB
Description: Five persons were shot dead at the Niger Bridge Head in Onitsha, while at least 25 others sustained varying degrees of injuries when members of the Indigenous people of Biafra, IPOB, and Movement for the Actualization of Sovereign State of Biafra, MASSOB, clashed with Joint Task Force, JTF, comprising the Army and the Police, which had a road block at the location. An army spokesman said the troops were acting in self-defense.
Secondary.Source.Type: The Guardian, Vanguard, Vanguard website, Lagos, Leadership, This Day
Citation: AFNWS00020151218ebci000b6, AFPR000020151218ebci0053e, AFNWS00020151218ebci000ho, BBCAP00020151218ebci0018h, AFNWS00020151221ebcl000fa, AFNWS00020151221ebcl001wc

Description: Cameroonian troops have killed at least 70 residents of Kirawa-Jimni village while chasing Islamic insurgents in the Gwoza area of Borno state in northeastern Nigeria, fleeing villagers said.

An official says at least ten civilians were killed on Wednesday when a fighter jet belonging to Kenyan Defense forces (KDF) bombed a residential area in the Beer Xaani area near an al-Shabaab base 45 km west of the southern port city of Kismayo.
Secondary.Source.Type: Shabelle Media Network, Somali Puntlandpost website in Somali 24 Dec 15

Description: Villagers in al-Hajawara in northern Hajjah province said multiple bombings by the Saudi air force killed 12 people inside their homes and wounded 30 others.
Comments: Could not geolocate al-Hajawara; coordinates are for arbitrary location in Hajjah province

Description: Residents in the southern district of Qabatiya (Qa'atabah) said 7 civilians were killed in a Saudi air force attack on a market.
Residents said war planes launched two raids on the village of Bani al-Haddad, in the northern Hajjah province on the border with Saudi Arabia, killing 15 people and wounding 18 others.

Description: Burundian singer Pascal Tresor Nshimirimana was killed yesterday [3 January] when he was shot in the back by police. Popularly known as Lissouba, the 27 year old leader of a citizen movement was found dead in Musaga.

Cameroonian troops pursuing Boko Haram fired rocket-propelled grenades indiscriminately that killed a family of four, then shot and killed two other civilians in the town of Ashigashiya, Borno State, Nigerian villagers said Tuesday. Reports indicate that this is part of apparent attempt by Cameroon to create a no-go zone along the border where troops could shoot anything that moved.

Eight members of the Indigenous People of Biafra [IPOB], were allegedly shot dead by the military in Aba in Abia State during their peaceful protest over the continued detention of their leader, Nnamdi Kanu, according to the spokesman of IPOB. At least 30 people were injured by bullets.

At least 40 villagers in Gwadale border community under Gwoza local government area of Borno state were feared killed on Monday as soldiers of the Cameroonian national allegedly opened fire on fleeing Boko Haram believed to have ran over to Nigeria, witnesses said. Cameroon is denying reports

Perp.Non.State.Ethnic: Arab Beni Halba tribe and Masalit tribe?
Victim.Identity.Ethnic.National.Citizens: Arab Beni Halba tribe and Masalit tribe?
Description: At least 14 people have been killed and ten wounded in unrest in Sudan's West Darfur, sources said Monday, the day after security forces dispersed protesters outside government buildings in the state capital Geneina.
Comments: Appears to be related to ethnic conflict between Arab Beni Halba tribe and Masalit tribe though details are confusing, even for Sudan

Locality: Kurtun-Dhoole, Warta Adan Jibril and Ey Kumoogle
Description: Seven people have been killed after Kenyan fighter jets reportedly bombed residential areas in Kurtun-Dhoole, Warta Adan Jibril and Ey Kumoogle in south of Somalia's Gedo region, witness and elders said.
Secondary.Source.Type: Shabelle Media Network, Shabelle Media Network website, Mogadishu
Comments: Could not geolocate any of those names; coordinates for arbitrary location in southern Gedo region

Description: The Kenyan army have "killed the commissioner of Ceel Adde District in Likooleey area" in southwestern Somalia, reports privately-owned Shabeelle website on 27 January. A Somali government official confirmed the killing; the Kenyan army had no comment.
Comments: Kenya army seems to be engaged in revenge attacks in the Ceel Adde area following an al-Shabaab attack which al-Shabaab claims killed 100 Kenya soldiers. Exact date of killing unclear.

Description: Turkish army tank shelling and artillery bombardment have killed 12 Kurdish civilians in the Zap district of the city of Silopi southeast of the country, the Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK)-funded SNN website reported on 5 January.
Secondary.Source.Type: Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) media website in Sorani Kurdish 5 Jan 16

Description: Turkish soldiers have killed 31 Kurdish civilians in the "besieged" Kurdish city of Cizre southeast Turkey on 6 January, the pro-Kurdistan Democratic Party (KDP) Rudaw news portal reported on the same day.

At least 15 Yemeni civilians were killed and 25 wounded in an air strike by a Saudi-led military coalition near the village of Bilad al-Rus, around 40 km (25 miles) south of Sanaa, residents said on Wednesday

Air strikes by Saudi-led warplanes on northern Yemen have killed six people in the village of Dhahyan, including an ambulance driver working for Doctors Without Borders (MSF), and wounded 40 others, the relief agency said Friday.
A Saudi-led coalition air strike killed a Yemeni judge allied with the Houthis and seven members of his family in the capital Sanaa on Sunday, residents said. Five other family members were injured.
Comments: Saudis claim targeting wasn't deliberate, and Saudi bombs frequently hit a mile or more from their targets, so this is probably correct

Description: Airstrikes by a Saudi-led coalition targeting Yemen's Shiite rebels killed at least 8 civilian overnight in the capital, Sanaa, officials said on Saturday.

Twenty eight people were killed during three days of the Jat quota agitation in the North Indian state of Haryana, Director General of Police Yashapl Singhal said. Over 200 persons including few security personnel were also injured during the agitation.
Police in Papua New Guinea shot and killed 11 prisoners and wounded 17 after a mass prison breakout at the Buimo prison in Lae.
Six people were killed and 14 others were wounded in an air raid on the area of Tir Janga, 10 kilometres southeast of Golo in western Jebel Marra on Wednesday.
Comments: Could not geolocate Tir Janga; coordinates are for Golo

Description: Eleven people were killed and five others wounded in aerial bombardments on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday in multiple villages in the vicinity of Guldo in Central Darfur.
The Peoples' Democratic Party (HDP), which has Kurdish origins , named nine civilians who had been killed in Cizre over the weekend.

An airstrike by a military coalition led by Saudi Arabia hit a cement factory in Amran on Wednesday evening, killing at least 15 people, including civilian workers in nearby businesses, according to local security and medical officials.
Comments: Story is unclear whether factory was in Amran city or just somewhere in the province; coordinates are for the city

Description: Five members of the same family were killed when a Saudi-led coalition air strike hit their home in Yemen's rebel-held capital Sanaa, rescuers and neighbours said Wednesday. Both the father and mother were journalists.
Comments: Not clear whether the house was deliberately targeted

Description: Saudi-led airstrikes targeting Shiite rebels killed at least 22 civilians, when they hit a market area outside the capital on Saturday, Yemeni security officials said.
Five people were killed by police dispersing riots in the coastal town of Mathbaria prior to local elections. Police say the crowds were attacking them with rocks and machetes.

Seven people were killed and 20 others injured in attacks by army forces and allied militiamen on areas in the southern part of Jebel Marra on Saturday. Ten villages northwest of Kalokiting burned to ashes, making about 30,000 villagers homeless, a listener told Radio Dabanga from Koni, north of Kalokiting.
Comments: Could not geolocate Kalokiting; coordinates are for Koni

Locality: Qob-Yahas, Ran Gobo and Raso villages
Description: An airstrike by unidentified fighter jets has claimed the lives of at least ten people, including unarmed civilians near Bulo-Burde in central Somalia, an senior official said on Sunday.
Comments: Total includes al-Shabaab combatants; no separate tally was given

Description: At least six civilians were killed on Friday as Yemeni pro-government forces gained ground around third city Taez which has been under rebel siege for several months, officials said.
At least 106 civilians were killed and 47 injured when three Saudi airstrikes attacked attacked the center of Khamees Market in Mustaba'a, Hajjah, northern Yemen according to UNICEF.
Comments: Quite an assortment of numbers reported since many bodies were not intact; the UNICEF figure is a later one. One local tribal leader aligned with the Houthis, said 33 of the dead were fighters, but no other reports support this.

Description: 14 civilians, have been killed in two days of fighting between pro-government forces and Shiite Huthi rebels on the outskirts of Taiz in Yemen, officials said Sunday

Following extensive fighting in Konduz, The head of Konduz provincial hospital, Dr Mohammad Na'im Manghal, told Afghan Islamic Press [AIP] that since yesterday until this morning, 16 April, five dead bodies and 85 injured individuals were taken to the hospital. He said all the deaths were children. There are security forces, women and children among the wounded individuals.
Secondary.Source.Type: Afghan Islamic Press news agency, Peshawar
Comments: Wounded is estimate for civilians

Description: A Gambian opposition leader and two other members of his party were tortured to death in a prison following their arrest last week at a protest in Banjul. Two female members of the party are said to be in a coma.
Sources to Al-Jazeera TV: Five civilians have been killed, including a child, in Iraqi army bombardment of Fallujah and its vicinity

Text of report by Somali pro-Islamist news website Falaar on 23 April: Reports coming our way from an area lying 5 kilometres from the village of Dacdheer, Mudug Region, say that Ethiopian troops serving with African Union Mission in Somalia [today] killed more than 25 civilians there.
Comments: No idea how credible the report is, but this group does not routinely report these sorts of things. Coordinates for "Dharkeyn Celin", which is the closest thing I found phonetically; probably is not the right place but is in Mudug

Description: Five civilians have been killed and more than 10 wounded as a result of Ukrainian shelling of the town of Olenivka near Donetsk, the deputy defence minister of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (so-called DPR) Eduard Basuryn (Basurin) has told a briefing.
Secondary.Source.Type: Donetsk News Agency, Donetsk; Donetsk News Agency, Donetsk; Donetsk News Agency, Donetsk; Donetsk News Agency, Donetsk; Luhansk Information Centre; Luhansk Information Centre; Luhansk Information Centre;
Comments: Ukrainian military denied responsibility

Description: Six civilians have been killed and three others wounded as a result of a night raid on a house by Afghan military forces in the Amir Khelo area of Pol-e Khomri, capital of [northern] Baghlan Province.
Secondary.Source.Type: Afghan Islamic Press news agency, Peshawar

Description: The head of Helmand civil society, Sardar Mohammad Hamdard, told Afghan Islamic Press [AIP] on Tuesday that they have recently received information from the people of the area that they had sustained casualties in the operation which started in Marja District yesterday. He added: "Eight people had been martyred and some others lost their body parts during the operation."
Secondary.Source.Type: Afghan Islamic Press news agency, Peshawar

Victim.Identity.Political: members of the Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB)
Description: No fewer than five civilians have been confirmed dead following protest by members of the Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB), in Asaba on Monday.

During yesterday's rally in Onitsha, Anambra State, a combined team of the military and police clashed with members of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) during the celebration of Biafra Day in the commercial city. The clash, THISDAY checks revealed, left 32 people dead and many injured.
Six children - three of them from one family - have reportedly been killed in air strikes my MiG fighter jets on residential areas within Heiban town in the Nuba mountains in South Kordofan.

An air strike by the Saudi-led coalition killed eleven civilians from the same family by mistake on Wednesday, a provincial official said. Emirati warplanes targeted the home of a suspected member of the Islamic State (IS) jihadist group in Huta, the capital of southern Lahij province, but missed and hit an adjacent house, the official told AFP.

The mayor of Reitoca in Honduras is believed to lead a gang which killed five people on Sunday. On that day, unidentified gunmen fired on a vehicle carrying members of a local church, killing one of the occupants and wounding another. When other people tried to transfer the body and the wounded person to hospital, another attack was mounted that killed four people.

At least 22 people were killed when police clashed with squatters in Mathura, in Uttar Pradesh in north India, officials said on Friday, the violence erupting after protesters killed two police officers during an operation to clear thousands of people from a public park. More than 100 people were injured in the melee.

Seven people, including a local journalist, were killed when teacher protests turned violent near the town of Asuncion Nochixtlan in the Mexican state of Oaxaca, authorities said. The clashes between teachers, state police and local residents also left 53 civilians injured, according to the Oaxaca state government.

Aerial bombardments during the past week struck areas of western Jebel Marra east of Nierteti and killed six villagers in total, as well as wounding 18. Dozens of homes were burnt and a number of livestock was killed.
Comments: Could not geolocate Nierteti; coordinates are for arbitrary location in western Jebel Marra. Article also somewhat unclear on the exact date but named the victims.

Description: Eight displaced Syrians, including four children, were killed by Turkish border guards while trying to flee their war-torn country Sunday morning, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. Eight more people were wounded.
Comments: Location approximate: article the victims were fleeing the town of Manbij. Also not clear which side of border, so technically this might have been in Syria (the incident is not in the other Syrian data)

Description: Clashes between the Sudan People's Liberation Army (SPLA) and members of the Fertit tribe began on June 24, say sources in the city. The SPLA is predominantly made up of members of the Dinka tribe. At least 43 people were killed in the fighting, according to a government statement on June 28.
Comments: Total may include some combatants, but eyewitness reports, including several from UN personnel, indicate there were substantial civilian casualties

Description: An airstrike early on Tuesday by a Saudi-led coalition targeting a truck transporting weapons for Shiite rebels in Yemen's southern province of Taiz killed 19 civilians and wounded 8, security officials said.
Comments: Location approximate: articles mention Taiz province (not city) but gives no other detail beyond ``a commercial road that lies between two villages''

Description: At least seven civilians, including two children, were killed in two air raids Tuesday that hit a Yemeni town, Mahfid, controlled by Al-Qaeda, a local official and tribesmen said.
A Saudi-led coalition air strike killed 10 Yemeni civilians and wounded at least another 15 in a village market for smuggled fuel in the Hayfan district in the southern province of Lahj on Tuesday
Comments: Geonames puts Hayfan in Taiz, not Lahj (next province south of Taiz)

Description: Myanmar soldiers killed at least five civilians in their custody last month in Mong Yaw village and will be prosecuted, a senior general announced Wednesday in a rare case of the military taking responsibility for carrying out atrocities against ethnic minorities.

At least 10 people, including police officers and civilians, have been reportedly killed in the northern city of Gondar in Ethiopia following days of protests, according activists and a monitor. The violence is believed to have started after the attempted arrests by Ethiopian government troops of some leaders of the Amhara ethnic group.
Secondary.Source.Type: Addis Standard, Al Jazeera, Deutsche Welle
Comments: Casualty reports are very unclear, and it seems five or six police were killed; other reports give a total death toll of 12 or 28, so probably the civilian deaths are above the threshold. No reports on injuries

Description: At least 37 people have been killed and more than 3000 injured in wide-spread protests in Kashmir in the week following the killing of a top Kashmiri rebel leader on 8 July.
Comments: Coordinates for Kashmir generally

Description: At least 14 Somali civilians were killed and three others following a battle between Ethiopian troops and al-Shabab fighters Wardinle village, 30 kilometers west of Baidoa town in southwestern Somalia on Sunday, officials and witnesses said.
Comments: Killings appear to have been deliberate and occurred following the battle. Could not geolocate Wardinle; coordinates are for arbitrary location about 30 km west of Baidoa

Perp.State.Military: military forces engaged in coup attempt
Description: 162 civilians were killed and more than 2,000 injured in Istanbul and Ankara during the attempted coup against Turkish President Erdogan
Comments: Hundreds of additional articles; geocoordinates for Istanbul; civilian death and injured totals from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Turkish_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat_attempt

Description: A mayor and four local police officers have been arrested from the town of Alvaro Obregon in Michoacn state in connection with the murder of 10 people who were killed and burned over the weekend in Cuitzeo, the state's governor said Tuesday.
Comments: Probably drug-related

Description: As protests continue in East and West Harerghe zones in southwestern Ethiopia, Agazi [special army unit tasked to deal with violence] troops shot dead six people and wounded 26 others in Awodai town.
Secondary.Source.Type: Ethiomedia website in English 1 Aug 16, Zehabesha.com in Amharic 2 Aug 16
Comments: Could not geolocate Awodai or any of the place names mentioned in the articles; coordinates are for arbitrary location in SW Ethiopia

Description: Soldiers killed at least 76 civilians and extensively looted civilian property during and after clashes between government and opposition forces in South Sudan's capital, Juba, in July, 2016, Human Rights Watch said. In many cases, government forces appeared to target non-Dinka civilians.
At least fifteen people were killed during fresh clashes between police and anti-government protesters in Nemekte, in the Oromo region in western Ethiopia on Saturday, local sources said

At least twenty-seven people were killed by police at a protest rally called by the [opposition] Semayawi Party was held in Bahir Dar, the capital of Amhara Regional State in northwestern Ethiopia. Five policemen and an unspecified number of civilians were injured.
Secondary.Source.Type: Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation TV (formerly ETV), Addis Ababa, Al Jazeera

Description: A young college teacher in Indian-controlled Kashmir was killed while he was in the custody of the Indian army after soldiers took dozens of people from their homes in the tense Himalayan region, residents said Thursday. A police official, who spoke on customary condition of anonymity, said at least 25 people, including the victim's brother, were reported injured.
Five members of a North Darfur family were killed in an air raid in Benghazi in Libya on Friday.
Comments: Report states ""A number of people with other nationalities were killed as well."" but provides no numbers

Description: About 13 inmates in Abakaliki Prisons in Ebonyi State and one prison guard were believed to have been killed in the early hours of yesterday, when the inmates of the prison rioted over the poor meals served to them by the prison and attempted to escape from the facility. During the riot, the inmates allegedly snatched a rifle from one of the guards in the prison yard and shot some at them, prompting the officials to defend themselves. At least 10 people were injured.
Secondary.Source.Type: This Day, Rhythm FM in English 0600 gmt 19 Aug 16, Premium Times

Description: An air raid by a Sudanese Air Force Antonov at Kabe near Guldo in Darfur's Jebel Marra on Monday morning left five members of the same family dead.
At least 10 civilians have died in fighting between government and rebel forces in the northeast town of Pajut in South Sudan.
Comments: Could not geolocate Pajut ; coordinates are for Paloich, which is in the northeast and may or may not be the same place. About 300 combatants were also killed in this incident

Description: A Saudi-led coalition air strike killed nine civilians Odhar village in the Nehm area east of the Yemeni capital Sanaa on Sunday night, residents said. An additional 17 people were wounded.
Comments: Could not geolocate Odhar village ; coordinates are for Nehm area

Description: Airstrikes by the Saudi-led coalition bombed a food factory in the Yemeni capital of Sanaa early on Tuesday, killing 14 civilians working on an overnight shift and wounding 10, according to a factory official and medics.

Saudi-led air strikes on a school in a rebel-held province of northern Yemen have killed 10 children and wounded 28 others, Doctors Without Borders (MSF) said on Sunday. "We received 10 dead children and 28 wounded, all under the age of 15, who are victims of air strikes on a Koranic school in Haydan," in Saada province, said MSF spokeswoman Malak Shaher, adding the attack took place on Saturday.

A Saudi-led coalition air strike hit a hospital operated by Medecins Sans Frontieres in the Abs district of Hajja province in northern Yemen on Monday, killing at least 11 people and wounding 19, the aid group said.

An airstrike on a residential area near the Yemeni capital of Sana on Tuesday killed 17 civilians, most of them women and children. The attack on Tuesday took place in the village of Al Madeed in Nehm District, northeast of the capital.
Comments: Could not geolocate Al Madeed; coordinates are for Nehm district.

Description: Airstrikes by a Saudi-led coalition in northern Yemen killed 11 civilians, including women and children, in an overnight attack in the city of Saada,
Comments: Report indicates there were also wounded, but provides no further details.

Description: At least 16 members of the extended family of a Yemeni mosque imam, inlcuding four children, were killed on Wednesday in an air strike on their family home in Sa'dah in northern Yemen by the Saudi-led Arab coalition, a Reuters witness, a medic and a resident said.

According to information obtained by Deutsche Welle, Angolan security forces killed about 37 members of the Adventist sect "Light of the World" in two discrete attacks on 9 and 13 August in a village in Cassongue district in central Angola.
Comments: Village is not named but otherwise the report has considerable eyewitness detail. Group had killed nine policemen last year so a retaliatory attack is plausible

Description: There have been protests by residents of Kasumbalesa, about 9 km from Lubumbashi city, Haut Katanga province [southeastern DRCongo] this morning. Five people have been killed and many wounded in the protests, said the local civil society organisation.
Secondary.Source.Type: Radio Okapi (Goma) in French 1700 gmt 9 Sep 16

Description: More than 38 civilians have been killed in Congo's capital, Kinshasa, in two days of street clashes between security forces and protesters angered over a delayed presidential election, a senior Human Rights Watch researcher said Tuesday.
Primary.Source.Type: AFP, Reuters, CNN, BBC, All Africa, AP
Secondary.Source.Type: Radio Okapi website, Kinshasa, Al Jazeera, UN report
Comments: At least six police killed by protestors

Description: Six civilians have been killed and at least 29 students wounded during fighting between government and militia combatants attributed to traditional chief Kamwena Nsapu in Kananga city, Kasai central province

India on Tuesday killed at least eight people trying to sneak across its disputed border with Pakistan in Kashmir near the town of Uri, army officials said, two days after a deadly assault on an Indian army base that New Delhi blamed on its neighbour.
Comments: No indication of the civil/military status of the ""intruders"" and article is inconsistent on whether they are actually killed or just fired on

Description: At least nine civilians including women and children were killed in an air strike near the oasis town of Houn (Hun) in central Libya on Tuesday, a hospital doctor and local officials said.

Eight people were reportedly killed, ten others abducted, and a number of women were raped in the villages of Tema and Donkey Baashim in northern Kutum, North Darfur by a group of paramilitary Border Guards, over the weekend.
Comments: Could not geolocate Tema and Donkey Baashim villages; coordinates are for Kutum

Description: African Union [Amisom] troops have killed six people in a shooting incident in Muri, Lower Shabelle region [southern Somalia], reports say.
Comments: Coordinates are for Muryaale, which is the best approximation I could find for "Muri" in Lower Shabeelle

Description: Huthi rebels in Yemen said on Friday an air raid by Saudi-led coalition warplanes on a house northeast of the capital Sanaa killed nine civilians including women and children.

At least nine civilians, including four children, were killed on Thursday in an air strike by the Saudi-led coalition on a residential building in the Amran provincial capital, Amran city, residents said. At least five other people were injured in the attack early on Thursday on the three-storey apartment building,

Saudi-led airstrikes on workers drilling a water well in the village of Beit Saadan of the Arhab district in northern Yemen have reportedly killed 30 people and wounded 17, including first responders and children, a U.N. official said Monday
Comments: Could not geolocate Beit Saadan; coordinates are for Arhab district

Description: Residents reported an air strike hit the home of Sheikh Maqbool al-Harmali, a local tribal chief in Hairan district of Hajjah province, killing six civilians.

At least 6 civilians were killed on Wednesday when a Saudi-led coalition air strike hit a house in western Yemen, residents and medics said. Fighter jets of an Arab alliance launched missiles on Wednesday at a presidential palace in the Red Sea port city of Hodeidah occupied by leaders of the Iran-allied Houthi militia, a resident told Reuters. A raid hit a house adjacent to the palace killing six civilians and wounding 12 according to a medic.
At least 34 civilians were killed and 55 wounded when Saudi-led airstrikes attacked a neighborhood in Yemen's central port city of Hodeida on Wednesday, medical sources in the region told CNN.
Arab coalition air strikes killed nine people and wounded eleven in Houthi-controlled Ibb city in central Yemen late on Saturday, medical sources and residents in the area told Reuters.
Warplanes from the Sadui-led coalition hit "by mistake" a vehicle at Razah in Saada province, killing five civilians, said an official.
Comments: Not sure whether admitting ""a mistake"" qualifies as ""regrets""

Description: At least eight civilians have been killed in a crossfire during a firefight between the army and rebels in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).
Seven killed during protest between young motorcycle taxi drivers, DRCongo police in Baraka township, in Fizi territory, Sud Kivu province. Five people were seriously wounded.
Secondary.Source.Type: Radio Okapi (Goma) in French 1100 gmt 17 Oct 16

Description: Fifteen women were killed and another 50 wounded in an air strike that targeted a Shiite place of worship at Dakuk
Comments: Motive is unclear and later reports haven't clarified anything

Description: In Myothugyi village in Maungdaw, a township in Rakhine State close to the border, seven villagers, all members of the Rohingya Muslim minority, were said by local villagers and a journalist to have been shot to death when joint army and police forces began a counteroperation on Monday.
Comments: Could not geolocate Myothugyi village; coordinates are for Maungdaw township

Description: Several Rohingya residents from the area of Kyetyoepyin village said they believed at least 19 people, including eight women, were killed by security forces that day. They also say it was the soldiers who set a large part of the village on fire.
Comments: Area under lockdown so difficult to get detailed information. Could not geolocate Kyetyoepyin village; coordinates are for Maungdaw

Description: Soldiers and police opened fire on newly outlawed Shiite group Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN) procession in the town of Funtua in northern Katsina state, killing 10 people and injuring scores of others, IMN spokesman Husseini Yero told AFP.

Saudi-led warplanes struck a funeral at a community hall in the Yemeni capital Sanaa, the country's Houthi-run administration said on Saturday, but the coalition denied any role in the attack. More than 140 mourners were killed, and more than 525 were injured, according to local health officials cited by the United Nations
At least 17 civilians were killed and seven wounded in Yemen's southwestern province of Taiz on Saturday by a Saudi-led coalition air strike that struck a house in the al-Salw district

Saudi-led coalition air strikes on rebel-held security buildings in the town of Zaidia near the city of Hodeidah in western Yemen have killed at least 60 people, many of them inmates buried under the rubble of their detention centre. Dozens were wounded.
Comments: Coordinates are for Az Zayd_yah, Al Hudaydah which is probably the right area. Saudis claim the rebel-held prison -- that is, one housing people the *rebels* had detained -- was a command center.

Description: Pakistan's Foreign Ministry said in a statement that six civilians on the Pakistani side in the Nikial and Jandrot areas had been killed by shelling from India Monday, and eight injured.
Comments: Coordinates are for Nikial

Description: Venezuelan lawmakers voted unanimously Tuesday to issue a declaration condemning the massacre of 12 civilians by soldiers in the town of Barlovento. The victims were abducted on 16 Oct and their rotting bodies were recently discovered in a mass grave. According to an opposition legislator, an additional 14 people are still missing. The soldiers involved have been arrested are being charged with murder.
Comments: Exact date of death is uncertain, but probably proximate to date of abduction.

Description: At least seven civilians on the Indian side of the Line of Control (LoC) in the Ramgrah sector of India's Samba district and Manjakote area of Rajouri district were killed Tuesday and 15 others injured in shelling that came from the Pakistani side, according to local Indian authorities.
Comments: Coordinates are for Samba district

Description: Eight civilians were killed and at least seven wounded yesterday when security agents and members of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), otherwise known as Shi'ites clashed in Kano City over the yearly procession of the group.
Six prisoners were confirmed dead and 11 injured after officials responded to a disturbance at Oke Kura Prison, Ilorin City, Kwara State
Comments: Guards are accused of beating prisoners to death; officials deny this but confirmed the death total.

Description: A Philippine mayor who had been accused of drug trafficking by President Rodrigo Duterte was shot and killed by police officers in his jail cell in Leyte's Baybay city on Saturday, the police said; his cell-mate was also killed.
Comments: Police claim victim was killed during a "firefight" that occurred while they were searching his cell for drugs. Others, including a member of the Philippine Commission on Human Rights and a later 6-Dec-2016 report by the National Bureau of Investigation, are skeptical of this account.

Description: A member of Somalia's electoral college was shot dead in Adado town, the interim administrative headquarters of Galmudug state. The clan elder, whose name has not been released up till now has been killed by AU soldiers at the entrance of a polling station as he was en route to cast his vote among candidates, sources said.
Comments: Curious report: no followup, nor any outrage about the killing being due to AU soldiers; no detail on "sources"

Description: Twelve Yemeni civilians were killed and six wounded by a Saudi-led air strike while riding in a pickup truck in the Hiran area of northwest Hajja province early on Wednesday, residents said.
Comments: Geonames shows three ""Hiran"" in Hajja; this may or may not be the correct one

Description: Yemeni security and medical officials say at least 13 civilians have been killed by an airstrike by the Saudi-led military coalition in rural areas northeast of Hodeida.
Comments: Coordinates for arbitrary location northeast of Hodeida

Description: The head of the U.N. human rights agency said on Friday that Congolese security forces had killed at least 40 people, wounded at least 107, and arrested 460 in protests against President Joseph Kabila this week in Kinshasa, Lubumbashi, Boma and Matadi.
Primary.Source.Type: Reuters, AFP, NYT, AP, BBC, All Africa
Secondary.Source.Type: Radio Okapi website, Kinshasa, Al Jazeera, Zambia Reports, Radio Okapi (Goma) in French 0700 gmt 22 Dec 16, Deutsche Welle
Comments: Coordinates are for Kinshasa

Description: Iraqi air force strikes on a busy market in the Islamic State-held town of Qaim, in Iraq's Anbar province near Iraq's western border with Syria killed dozens of people on Wednesday, including many women and children, two parliamentarians and local hospital sources said. Anbar lawmaker Ahmed al-Salmani and hospital sources said 55 civilians were killed.
Secondary.Source.Type: Telegram messaging service in Arabic 0000 gmt 7 Dec 16
Comments: ISIS says 120 killed

Description: Traditional elder Mohamed Hassan said ANISOM troops opened fire on a minibus in Qoryooley town in Lower Shabelle region on Sunday. All six passengers were killed, he said.The African Union Mission for Somalia said it was investigating "the unfortunate incident in Qoryooley..."

In a separate incident, residents in Marka town said an AMISON armored vehicle smashed into a home, killing a mother and four children. Resident Ahmed Sheikh Ali said the crash occurred after a bomb attack targeted an army convoy.
Comments: Other report says troops simply shot the woman and children

Description: 10 men from al-Arish were killed in an incident that police claim was a shootout but local residents and relatives say was an extrajudicial execution because most of the men had been taken into police custody weeks earlier; Amnesty International has called for an investigation of the incident
A journalist who covered police affair was shot dead by two men wearing police uniforms on Tuesday in San Pedro Sula in northern Honduras, hospital officials said
Residents of the Iraqi city of Mosul said up to 30 civilians died in an air strike on a district held by Islamic State this week.

At least 112 civilians were killed in Tuesday's Nigerian Air Force strike on a refugee camp and 97 were wounded, according to a local official. The Nigerian government and the military have apologized for the attack and are investigating it.
Primary.Source.Type: AP, AFP, CNN, All Africa, Reuters
Secondary.Source.Type: Premium Times, The Guardian, Vanguard, Daily Trust, Red Cross/Crescent, MSF
Comments: Casualty totals are from results of investigation released 2 February and are consistent with MSF's initial estimates

Description: Eleven people were killed when Nigerian security forces cracked down on a demonstration in the city of Port Harcourt supporting the inauguration of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) group said Friday, though police denied there were any deaths.
Comments: Police denial was of the ""to the best of our knowledge..."" variety; IPOB posted photograph of at least one dead.

Description: Gunmen believed to be Nigeria's Boko Haram Islamic extremists attacked a convoy of motorists along a recently secured part of the Maiduguri- Damboa- Biu road near Bullabulin village, killing at least seven people and injuring many others, witnesses said. One witness said most deaths occurred due to indiscriminate fire by soldiers escorting convoy of vehicles.

Gunmen in military uniforms have killed eleven people, mostly women, and wounded about 60, at a camp for displaced person near Nertiti in the Jabal Marra area in Sudan's war-torn Darfur region, residents and an NGO said Monday. Locals described this as an apparent revenge attack for the murder of a soldier.
Comments: Could not geolocate Nertiti; coordinates are for Jabal Marra

Description: An air strike by the Saudi-led coalition hit on Sunday a house in the village of Wadi Habab, in the Sarwah region in the province of Marib, east of the capital Sanaa, killing five members of the same family, a military officials told AFP.

An air strike by the Saudi-led coalition on a primary school in the district of Nihm in rebel-held northern Yemen on Tuesday killed five people including two children, medical and military sources said. Thirteen people were wounded in the attack.

Police in southwestern Democratic Republic of Congo on Friday killed at least eight members of Bundu dia Kongo (BDK) as they approached the morgue in the town of Kimpese to recover the bodies of fellow members killed in protests last month, local activists said,
Comments: Local activists reported both 8 and 12 deaths; police acknowledged ""several"" people had been killed

Description: At least five people were killed Monday when police in Conakry, Guinea clamped down on hundreds of students who demonstrated with stones and sticks amid teacher strikes that have kept them out of class for weeks. Hospital officials said 30 people were injured, including members of the security forces

Victim.Identity.Political: protesters loyal to Shi'ite cleric Moqtada al-Sadr
Description: At least seven protesters loyal to Shi'ite cleric Moqtada al-Sadr were killed, and 174 others wounded, in clashes that happened Saturday with Iraqi security forces in downtown Baghdad
